text: Jean-Pierre Sauvage (; born 21 October 1944) is a French coordination chemist. He worked at Strasbourg University. He has specialized in supramolecular chemistry for which he has been awarded the 2016 Nobel Prize in Chemistry along with Sir J. Fraser Stoddart and Bernard L. Feringa. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:French chemists Category:Scientists from Paris
title: Jean-Pierre Sauvage
